text: It is amazing to what length this New York Times report goes in order to obscure the obvious, namely that Israeli occupation of the Golan was a direct result of Arab aggression against Israel. The Golan Heights Was Once an Arab Rallying Cry. Not Anymore.

text: Which btw doesn't mean that I condone annexation. But I think when it comes to hard power facts the change in Status Quo on the Syrian side with Iran near the border, Assad a client of Teheran and Hisbollah actually on the Golan is a much bigger deal than a symbolic gesture
author: clemenswergin

text: Short version: Occupation of Crimea is result of military aggression by Russia, Israeli occupation of Golan is result of Arab military aggression against Israel. Longer version would include gross violation of 242 by Syria in Yom Kippur war before Israel annexed Golan 1/1
author: clemenswergin

text: So does this also hold true for wars of aggression in which the aggressive country loses territory? Is that not an incentive to wage war over and over again, because you don't really risk losing your own territory with it?
author: clemenswergin

text: No, but it is a plea to not engage in hyperbole and false equivalences about Golan and Crimea
author: clemenswergin

text: I still maintain that comparing Golan to Crimea is lazy thinking
author: clemenswergin

text: Well, how about the principle of losing territory through waging war? Which is what the Golan Height issue is actually all about
author: clemenswergin

text: It really is lazy thinking to compare Crimea to the Golan Heights
author: clemenswergin
